graphicsutils 1.2.0
  • Reference
  • Articles
    • 'graphicsutils' an overview

graphicsutils a set of graphics-based utilities

Description

The graphicsutils is an R package that adds various graphics utilities based on the core package graphics. For now, the package is dedicated to store our graphical functions and improve our coding skills. Note that similar functions may already exist elsewhere (most likely in the plotrix package). However this package may help users to overcome some difficulties they may encounter with graphics.

Also, as graphicsutils is based on the graphics package, it is not designed to work with the grid system (and thereby it does not work with ggplot2). Related with this, is one very helpful article by Paul Murrell: The gridGraphics Package.

Status

Installation

The easiest way to install graphicsutils is to use the devtools package:

install.packages("devtools")
devtools::install_github("inSileco/graphicsutils")

Then, load it:

library(graphicsutils)
